info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:38PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Montrose and southwestern Gunnison Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 238 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles east of Montrose, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Montrose and southwestern Gunnison Counties, including the following locations... Sapinero and Cimmaron. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 109 and 127. Colorado 92 between mile markers 49 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
